name: Atsuta Horaiken Honten
short_description: The birthplace of 'Hitsumabushi', the famous chopped grilled eel rice bowl eaten in three ways.

name: Misokatsu Yabaton Yaba-cho Honten
short_description: Iconic restaurant famous for Miso Katsu, pork cutlet drenched in a rich red miso sauce.

name: Yamamotoya Honten Sakae
short_description: Specialty shop for Miso Nikomi Udon, featuring extremely firm noodles simmered in hatcho miso broth.

name: Misen Imaike Honten
short_description: The originator of 'Taiwan Ramen', a spicy noodle dish topped with minced meat and garlic chives.

name: Sekai no Yamachan Honten
short_description: Famous izakaya chain known for 'Maboroshi no Tebasaki', peppery fried chicken wings.

name: Konparu Osu
short_description: Retro kissaten famous for its substantial Ebi (Shrimp) Fry Sandwich and Ogura Toast.

name: Coffee Shop Kako Hanaguruma
short_description: Nagoya's first自家-roasting coffee shop, famous for its colorful confiture Ogura toast breakfast.

name: Miya Kishimen Jingu
short_description: Open-air noodle shop located within the sacred grounds of Atsuta Shrine, serving flat Kishimen noodles.

name: Spaghetti House Yokoi Sumiyoshi
short_description: The birthplace of 'Ankake Spaghetti', thick pasta topped with a spicy, starchy tomato-based sauce.

name: Yanagibashi Central Market
short_description: Known as 'Nagoya's Kitchen', offering fresh seafood stalls and sushi restaurants open from early morning.

name: Menya Hanabi Takabata Honten
short_description: The originator of 'Taiwan Mazesoba', a brothless noodle dish with spicy mince, egg yolk, and garlic.

name: Ibasho
short_description: Historic eel restaurant offering a quieter, more traditional Hitsumabushi experience with green tea chazuke.

name: Kishimen Sumiyoshi
short_description: Famous standing noodle shop on the Shinkansen/JR platform, beloved for its quick and tasty Kishimen.

name: Furaibo Sakae
short_description: The original creator of Nagoya-style Tebasaki (chicken wings), offering a slightly sweeter glaze than Yamachan.

name: Unagi Shirakawa Sakae Gas Bldg
short_description: Popular Hitsumabushi restaurant offering high-quality eel at a relatively accessible price point.

name: Tenmusu Senju
short_description: Famous for Tenmusu, bite-sized rice balls with a savory shrimp tempura filling.

name: Chez Shibata Nagoya
short_description: World-class patisserie led by Chef Takeshi Shibata, known for visually stunning and rich cakes.

name: Nagoya Cochin Ichio Nishiki
short_description: Specializes in Nagoya Cochin, the premium local chicken breed, served as sashimi, nabe, or grilled.

name: Osu Shopping District
short_description: Vibrant shopping arcade famous for street food like Agemanjyu, Karaage, and bubble tea.
